Pre-Game Insights: The second match of the ICC Men’s T20 WC EAP Sub-Regional Qualifier B 2024 will feature a highly anticipated clash between South Korea and Indonesia. Both teams have showcased their potential in the tournament, and this match is expected to be a closely contested affair.

South Korea, led by Jun Hyunwoo, has demonstrated a strong batting lineup, with players like Kim Daeyeon and Balage Dilruksha capable of scoring runs at a rapid pace. Their bowling attack, led by Kuldeep Gurjar, has also been impressive, with the ability to take wickets at regular intervals.

Indonesia, captained by Kadek Gamantika, has impressed with their all-round skills. Players like Gede Arta and Maxi Koda have been key contributors with both bat and ball. Their bowling attack, led by Fernandinho Banunaek, has also shown promise.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The South Korea vs Indonesia encounter promises to be a must-watch for fans of the sport.
The pitch is expected to be balanced and best suited to spin bowling.
The record of chasing teams is poor, with a winning percentage of 10%.
Others: The weather forecast is clear, with a temperature of 22°C.

The predicted playing XI for South Korea includes Jun Hyunwoo, Kim Daeyeon, Balage Dilruksha, Altaf Gill, Kuldeep Gurjar, An Hyobeom, Lee Kangmin, Aamir Lal, Sameera Maduranga, Iqbal Mudassir, and Fazil Muhammad.

The predicted playing XI for Indonesia includes Kadek Gamantika, Gede Arta, Ketut Artawan, Fernandinho Banunaek, Danilson Hawoe, Dharma Kesuma, Maxi Koda, Gede Priandana, Kirubasankar Ramamoorthy, Ahmad Ramdoni, and Padmakar Surve.
